meanings.definition: Not aware or having knowledge of something.
meanings.sent1: She was completely incognizant of the surprise party planned for her.
meanings.sent2: The child remained incognizant of the danger lurking nearby.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed incognizant of the chaos it caused by running around the house.
meanings.sent4: The stars above, incognizant of the world's troubles, continued to shine brightly.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds, incognizant of the sun's power, blocked its warm rays from reaching the earth.

meanings.sent1: The patient was incognizant of the medical procedures being performed on them.
meanings.sent2: The hiker, lost in the forest, was incognizant of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat, deeply asleep, was incognizant of the mouse sneaking past it.
meanings.sent4: The city, bustling with activity, seemed incognizant of the tranquility of the nearby countryside.
meanings.sent5: The flower, blooming in solitude, was incognizant of the beauty it added to the garden.
